## Reading CSV file

Analyze the target types. Filter and group data by target type. Read file and take a glimpse.

```{r global terrorism}
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
gtd_data <- read.csv("globalterrorismdb_0718dist.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
glimpse(gtd_data)
```

## Cleaning data

Select chosen column and clean NAs from nkill column.

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
gtd_clean <- gtd_data %>%
  select(iyear, country_txt, attacktype1_txt, nkill) %>%
  filter(!is.na(nkill))
# Removes rows where nkill (fatalities) is NA

# View a summary of cleaned data.
summary(gtd_clean)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
